intro: Odontarrhena obtusifolia, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Odontarrhena obtusifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
